description: '''Aurelio Martínez Suazo''' (26 September 1969 – 17 March 2025), professionally known as '''Aurelio''', was a Honduran singer-songwriter and politician. Known for his [[Garifuna music]], he was considered a cultural ambassador of the [[Garifuna]] people. According to ''[[The Guardian]]'', he became the leading Garifuna performer after the death of musician [[Andy Palacio]]. His album "Laru Beya" was considered among the best albums of Latin American music, according to [[Los 600 de Latinoamérica]], a 2024 ranking made by Latin American music critics.
